poem:
Title: Patience in Waiting

Beneath the weight of paper clocks, children wait,
In shadows cast by law's slow turn, they stand,
Hoping for the tender hand of help, year after year.
An odyssey of need, traversing ink-stained Atlas,
Defying time's unending tick.
Oh, the iron medley of voices silenced in the corners,
Against the stark white noise of indolence, they shine.
